title: Democracy and the Turnout Boom
sub_head: Voting numbers negate partisan prophecies of self-government’s doom.
body:
After the Senate failed to pass legislation Wednesday that would empower the federal government to intervene more aggressively in state voting rules, Majority Leader Chuck Schumer chided Republicans for failing “to acknowledge that our country faces a serious threat to democracy.”
For a country with the franchise in jeopardy, the U.S. sure has an awful lot of engaged voters, as Tuesday’s off-year election results showed.
